thread.title: Ignatian Scholarship Day | Canisius University - Buffalo, NY
thread.title_full: Ignatian Scholarship Day | Canisius University - Buffalo, NY

title: Ignatian Scholarship Day | Canisius University - Buffalo, NY
text: A highlight of the spring semester, Canisius University held its 17th annual Ignatian Scholarship Day (ISD) on Wednesday, April 17, 2024. Ignatian Scholarship Day is an opportunity for students to showcase their accomplished work from the current or previous semester for exhibit, presentation or performance. During the event, campus and community members enjoyed the academic research and creative works of undergraduate and graduate students. From exploring national threats to pioneering solutions in telemedicine for rural areas, their work reflects the university's commitment to academic excellence and innovation. Presentations were held within a conference environment similar to that of a learned society or organization, using the following forms of expression: • Poster displays • Paper presentations • Multi-media presentations • Artistic displays • Performances Canisius was founded in 1870 in Buffalo, NY, and is one of 27 Jesuit colleges and universities in the U.S. Consistently ranked among the top institutions in the Northeast, Canisius offers undergraduate, graduate and pre-professional programs distinguished by close student-faculty collaboration, mentoring and an emphasis on ethical, purpose-driven leadership. -30-
